tags.bridge:name: Smithfield Street Bridge
tags.description: The oldest bridge in Pittsburgh, opening in 1883. Widened twice. Inbound lane side carried streetcars until 1985. Has undergone multiple overhauls, the latest 1993-1994.

tags.description: Restricted lane, no authorized vehicles or pedestrians

The Martin Luther King Busway opened in 1981. It occupies the space was used for the railroad right of way, originally Pennsylvania Railroad, later Penn Central and then Conrail. The busway extends as far as Swissvale, PA.
